businessSummary.oneLiner: World's largest EV maker pivoting into a 'Physical AI Platform' spanning robotaxis, humanoid robots, and energy storage
businessSummary.description: Tesla is rapidly transforming from an EV maker into an integrated AI, robotics, and energy platform. FY2025 revenue was $94.8B, marking the first-ever annual revenue decline (-2.9%), with net income dropping 46.5%. However, the first Cybercab production unit rolled off Giga Texas on 2/17, making the robotaxi era a reality. FSD cumulative miles surpassed 8.2 billion, and the Netherlands' RDW approved FSD Supervised, opening the door for European expansion. European sales have declined for 14 consecutive months (January YoY -17%). On 2/27, the stock fell 1.45% to $402.67 amid inflation shock and Musk Epstein subpoena concerns.
howTheyMakeMoney: Vehicle sales: ~73% of revenue ($69.5B). Model 3/Y core, Model S/X discontinued Q2 2026
Energy: ~14% of revenue ($12.8B, +27% YoY). Megapack utility-scale storage
Services/Other: ~13% of revenue ($12.5B). Supercharger network, insurance, maintenance
FSD subscription: $99/mo autonomous driving software (subscription-only since Feb 2026)
keyProducts: Cybertruck (new budget AWD $59,990, Cyberbeast reduced to $99,990)
Optimus (humanoid robot, Fremont factory conversion underway)

keyMetrics.name: P/E (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Extremely high valuation based on EPS $1.09. Still elevated despite price decline

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Based on FY2026 EPS estimate of $2.09. Still premium valuation

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth
keyMetrics.interpretation: First-ever annual revenue decline. FY2026 +11.3% recovery expected

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Sharp decline from FY2024. Price cuts and competition pressure

keyMetrics.name: ROE
keyMetrics.interpretation: Sharp decline from FY2024. Profitability under pressure

growthDrivers.title: Cybercab production begins ‚Äî Robotaxi era dawns
growthDrivers.description: First steerless, pedalless Cybercab unit rolled off Giga Texas on 2/17. Priced at $30,000, mass production starts in April with plans to expand robotaxi service to 9 US cities in H1.

growthDrivers.title: FSD 8.2B miles + subscription pivot + first EU approval
growthDrivers.description: FSD Supervised surpassed 8.2B cumulative miles. Shifted to $99/month subscription-only model in February. Netherlands' RDW granted first EU approval for FSD Supervised.

growthDrivers.title: Optimus robot: Fremont factory conversion underway
growthDrivers.description: With Model S/X discontinuation in Q2 2026, Fremont lines are converting to Optimus humanoid robot production. Gen 3 in production, 1,000+ units operating in-factory.

growthDrivers.title: Grok AI European OTA + 2026 Model 3 interior upgrade
growthDrivers.description: Grok AI deployed to European Tesla vehicles via OTA 2026.2.6 update on 2/20. Website code revealed upcoming Model 3 upgrades including black headliner and 16-inch QHD display.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: US EV market share 50%+ #1, but globally overtaken by BYD. Software, manufacturing, and energy vertical integration plus 8.2B autonomous driving miles form the core moat.

moats.description: FSD Supervised 8.2B miles ‚Äî overwhelmingly largest training dataset vs. competitors.
In-house battery (4680), custom chips (HW4), software (FSD), charging infra (Supercharger).
NACS adopted as North American EV charging standard. GM, Ford, Rivian depend on Tesla's Supercharger network.

competitors.name: BYD
competitors.detail: 2025 global EV sales #1 (2.26M units, +28%). US entry limited by tariffs

competitors.name: Rivian (RIVN)
competitors.detail: R2 SUV ($45,000) launching 2026, directly competing with Model Y

recentNews.headline: Hillary Clinton demands Musk subpoena at Epstein hearing ‚Äî TSLA faces additional pressure
recentNews.significance: Clinton demands Musk subpoena in congressional oversight. Epstein files reportedly contain Musk-related records. Political risk escalation.

recentNews.headline: Inflation surprise triggers market selloff ‚Äî TSLA hit as rate-sensitive growth stock
recentNews.significance: February PPI above expectations. Rate cut hopes fading, negative for high-ticket EV demand.

recentNews.headline: Tesla Europe registrations down 17% YoY in January ‚Äî 14 months of consecutive decline
recentNews.significance: Contrasts with BYD's European expansion. Musk's political controversies hurting brand image.

recentNews.headline: $243M Autopilot verdict overturn attempt rejected
recentNews.significance: Court rejected Tesla's bid to overturn $243M jury verdict. Autopilot litigation risk persists.

recentNews.headline: Cybercab first production unit rolls off Giga Texas line
recentNews.significance: First steerless, pedalless robotaxi produced. Mass production starting April, H1 expansion to 9 US cities planned.

analystOpinions.notableComment: Wedbush $600 highest bull, GLJ $25 lowest. Consensus Hold. Musk Epstein subpoena issue expanding political risk premium.

risks.title: Musk Epstein subpoena risk ‚Äî political uncertainty surges
risks.description: Hillary Clinton demands Musk subpoena in Congress. Epstein files contain Musk-related records. CEO risk amplified.

risks.title: European sales declining 14 consecutive months
risks.description: January European registrations -17% YoY. Musk's political controversies deteriorating brand image.

risks.title: P/E 369x ‚Äî extreme valuation
risks.description: TTM P/E 369, Forward P/E 193. Significant downside risk without profitability recovery.

risks.title: Inflation surprise ‚Äî rate cut expectations retreat
risks.description: PPI exceeded expectations. Prolonged high rates negative for EV demand and growth stock valuations.

risks.title: Autopilot litigation risk persists
risks.description: $243M verdict overturn rejected. Additional lawsuits possible.

buyReasons.title: Cybercab production launch ‚Äî Robotaxi revenue model materializing
buyReasons.rationale: First unit produced 2/17 at $30,000 price point. April mass production. If successful, per-vehicle profitability dramatically improves vs. current models.

buyReasons.title: FSD subscription pivot ‚Äî recurring revenue model
buyReasons.rationale: $99/month subscription-only model creates stable recurring revenue base. 8.2B miles of data maintains technology leadership.

buyReasons.title: Energy business growing +27%
buyReasons.rationale: Megapack revenue at $12.8B. Structural growth in utility-scale storage demand diversifies away from vehicle revenue dependency.

buyReasons.title: Net cash $29.3B ‚Äî strong financial cushion
buyReasons.rationale: Debt/equity 0.18 with robust net cash position. Ample funding for Cybercab and Optimus investments.

overallOpinion: Tesla fell further to $402.67, remaining below the 50-day MA ($435). The Musk Epstein subpoena issue introduces a new political risk dimension.
With inflation surprising to the upside and the broader market crashing, rate-sensitive Tesla took a direct hit. At P/E 369x, retreating rate cut expectations are negative for valuation.
Long-term catalysts like Cybercab April production and FSD EU approval remain valid, but near-term political risks and macro headwinds are pressuring the stock.
